SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.levels

Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.levels.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelBoss, LevelOne, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Object
LevelParent is an abstract class that serves as the foundation for all game levels. It encapsulates common functionalities such as: - Managing the game loop with a timeline - Handling user input and controls - Spawning and managing enemy units and projectiles - Detecting collisions and updating the game state - Transitioning between levels or back to the main menu The class provides a structure for subclasses to define level-specific behavior.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth, javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Constructor for the LevelParent class. Initializes the core components and game state required for a level.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - Name of the background image file to be used for the level.
      screenHeight - The height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - The width of the game screen.
      playerInitialHealth - The initial health value for the user's plane.
      stage - The primary stage on which the game will be displayed.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes and adds the UserPlane to the scene graph. Ensures that the UserPlane is part of the game environment and visible to the player.

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected abstract void checkIfGameOver()
      Abstract method to check if the game is over. Must be implemented by subclasses to define the specific conditions for game over.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected abstract void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Abstract method to spawn enemy units into the game. Must be implemented by subclasses to determine the logic for enemy creation and placement.

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected abstract LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      Abstract method to create and return an instance of LevelView. Must be implemented by subclasses to initialize the visual representation of the level.
      Returns:
      A LevelView object representing the current level.

    • initializeBackgroundMusic

      private void initializeBackgroundMusic(String musicPath)
      Initializes the background music for the level. Loads a media file from the specified path and sets up a MediaPlayer to play it. The music will loop indefinitely during gameplay. If an error occurs while loading the music, an error message is printed to the console.
      Parameters:
      musicPath - The relative path to the background music file.

    • initializeScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene initializeScene()
      Initializes the game scene by setting up the background, friendly units, and UI elements. Adds functionality to handle key presses, such as toggling pause with the 'P' key.
      Returns:
      The initialized Scene object ready for gameplay.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by playing background music (if available) and initiating the game timeline. Also ensures the game background receives focus to capture user inputs.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(String levelName)
      Handles the transition to the next level in the game. Stops the current game timeline, logs the level transition, and notifies listeners of the change.
      Parameters:
      levelName - The name of the next level to transition to.

    • updateScene

      protected void updateScene()
      Updates the game scene by handling all game logic and interactions during each frame. This includes updating actors, spawning enemies, managing collisions, and checking game state. If the game is paused, the update logic is skipped.

    • initializeTimeline

      private void initializeTimeline()
      Initializes the game timeline for managing the main game loop. Sets the timeline to run indefinitely and defines a keyframe that triggers the update logic at regular intervals based on the specified delay.

    • initializeBackground

      private void initializeBackground()
      Initializes the game background and sets up input handling for user interactions. Configures the background's dimensions and key event listeners for controlling the user plane.

    • fireProjectile

      private void fireProjectile()
      Fires a projectile from the user-controlled actor. If the user successfully fires a projectile, it is added to the scene and tracked.

    • generateEnemyFire

      private void generateEnemyFire()
      Generates projectiles fired by enemy units. Iterates through all enemy units and spawns projectiles if an enemy fires.

    • spawnEnemyProjectile

      private void spawnEnemyProjectile(ActiveActorDestructible projectile)
      Adds a projectile fired by an enemy to the scene and tracks it. Ensures the projectile is properly rendered and managed in the game environment.
      Parameters:
      projectile - The projectile fired by an enemy, or null if no projectile is fired.

    • updateActors

      private void updateActors()
      Updates all active actors in the game. This includes friendly units, enemy units, user projectiles, and enemy projectiles. Each actor's update logic is executed, allowing for movement or state changes.

    • removeAllDestroyedActors

      private void removeAllDestroyedActors()
      Removes all actors that are marked as destroyed from their respective lists. This includes friendly units, enemy units, and projectiles. Helps maintain a clean game state.

    • removeDestroyedActors

      private void removeDestroyedActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
      Removes all actors that are marked as destroyed from the specified list and the scene. Ensures destroyed actors are no longer rendered or tracked in the game.
      Parameters:
      actors - The list of actors to check and remove if destroyed.

    • handlePlaneCollisions

      private void handlePlaneCollisions()
      Handles collisions between friendly units and enemy units (e.g., planes). Detects and processes interactions between these two groups.

    • handleUserProjectileCollisions

      private void handleUserProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between user projectiles and enemy units. Processes interactions where user projectiles hit enemies.

    • handleEnemyProjectileCollisions

      private void handleEnemyProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between enemy projectiles and friendly units. Processes interactions where enemy projectiles hit friendly units.

    • handleCollisions

      private void handleCollisions(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors1, List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors2)
      Detects and handles collisions between two lists of actors. If a collision is detected, both actors involved take damage.
      Parameters:
      actors1 - The first list of actors to check for collisions.
      actors2 - The second list of actors to check for collisions.

    • handleEnemyPenetration

      private void handleEnemyPenetration()
      Handles the scenario where enemy units penetrate the user's defenses. If an enemy breaches the defenses, the user takes damage, and the enemy is destroyed.

    • updateLevelView

      private void updateLevelView()
      Updates the level view by adjusting the display of hearts based on the user's current health. Removes hearts from the display to reflect the user's remaining health.

    • updateKillCount

      private void updateKillCount()
      Updates the kill count and player score based on the number of defeated enemies. Calculates the difference between the initial and current number of enemies, increments the score for each kill, and updates the score display.

    • updateScoreDisplay

      private void updateScoreDisplay()
      Updates the score display to reflect the current score. Ensures the score is visible and shown at the front of the UI.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Retrieves the current game score.
      Returns:
      The player's current score.

    • enemyHasPenetratedDefenses

      private boolean enemyHasPenetratedDefenses(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      Checks if an enemy has penetrated the player's defenses. An enemy is considered to have penetrated if its horizontal position exceeds the screen width.
      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy actor to check.
      Returns:
      true if the enemy has breached defenses, false otherwise.

    • winGame

      protected void winGame()
      Handles the logic for when the player wins the game. Stops the background music, halts the game timeline, and displays a win image.

    • loseGame

      protected void loseGame()
      Handles the logic for when the player loses the game. Stops the background music, halts the game timeline, and displays a game over image.

    • stopBackgroundMusic

      protected void stopBackgroundMusic()
      Stops the background music if it is currently playing. Ensures that the MediaPlayer is not null before attempting to stop the music.

    • getUser

      protected UserPlane getUser()
      Retrieves the user-controlled plane.
      Returns:
      The UserPlane object representing the player's controlled plane.

    • getRoot

      protected javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
      Retrieves the root group of the scene graph.
      Returns:
      The root Group object containing all nodes in the scene.

    • getCurrentNumberOfEnemies

      protected int getCurrentNumberOfEnemies()
      Gets the current number of enemy units in the game.
      Returns:
      The number of enemies currently active in the game.

    • addEnemyUnit

      protected void addEnemyUnit(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      Adds an enemy unit to the game. The enemy is added to the list of enemy units and also to the scene graph for rendering.
      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy unit to be added.

    • getEnemyMaximumYPosition

      protected double getEnemyMaximumYPosition()
      Retrieves the maximum Y-coordinate position for enemy units.
      Returns:
      The maximum Y position allowed for enemies on the screen.

    • getScreenWidth

      protected double getScreenWidth()
      Retrieves the width of the game screen.
      Returns:
      The width of the screen in pixels.

    • userIsDestroyed

      protected boolean userIsDestroyed()
      Checks if the user-controlled plane has been destroyed.
      Returns:
      true if the user's plane is destroyed, false otherwise.

    • updateNumberOfEnemies

      private void updateNumberOfEnemies()
      Updates the count of current enemies in the game. Synchronizes the `currentNumberOfEnemies` variable with the size of the enemy units list.

    • togglePause

      private void togglePause()
      Toggles the game's pause state. Pauses the game if it is currently running, or resumes it if it is paused.

    • pauseGame

      private void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game by stopping the timeline and displaying the pause menu. Sets the game state to paused and adds the pause menu to the scene.

    • resumeGame

      private void resumeGame()
      Resumes the game by playing the timeline and removing the pause menu from the scene. Sets the game state to running.

    • restartGame

      private void restartGame()
      Restarts the game by resetting the current level. Stops and clears the timeline, resets the user's stats, and initializes a new instance of the current level.

    • goToMainMenu

      private void goToMainMenu()
      Transitions the game to the main menu. Stops the background music and timeline, and initializes the main menu scene.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

      public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Adds a property change listener to the object. Listeners will be notified when properties change.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to add.

    • removePropertyChangeListener

      public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Removes a property change listener from the object. Prevents the listener from receiving further property change notifications.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.
